叫.definition: to shout; to call; to order; to ask; to be called; by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

叫做.definition: to be called; to be known as

叫停.definition: (sports) to call a time-out; to halt; to put a stop to; to put on hold

叫化子.definition: variant of 叫花子[jiao4 hua1 zi5]

叫喚.definition: to cry out; to bark out a sound

叫嚷.definition: to shout; to bellow one's grievances

叫屈.definition: to complain of an injustice; to lament sb's misfortune

叫床.definition: to cry out in ecstasy (during lovemaking)

叫早.definition: to give sb a wake-up call (at a hotel)

叫春.definition: to caterwaul; to call like an animal in heat

叫板.definition: to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song); (coll.) to challenge

叫法.definition: term; name; way of referring to sb or sth

叫牌.definition: to bid (bridge and similar card games)

叫聲.definition: yelling (sound made by person); barking; braying; roaring (sound made by animals)

叫苦.definition: to whine about hardships; to complain of one's bitter lot; to complain; to grumble

叫苦不迭.definition: to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly; incessant grievances

叫苦連天.definition: to whine on for days (idiom); to endlessly grumble complaints; incessant whining

叫車.definition: to call a cab (by phone); to request a ride (via an app)

叫醒.definition: to awaken; to wake sb up; to rouse

叫陣.definition: to challenge an opponent to a fight

叫雞.definition: rooster; cock; (slang) (Cantonese) to visit a prostitute
